markings: Weinstein Hammons Gallery label on back in center
medium: Fujucolor Crystal Archival print mounted to Plexiglas
text: Seeing a great work of art for the first time can be overwhelming. Photographer Robert Polidori captures the viewer’s experience of encountering Michelangelo’s iconic sculpture of a Biblical hero, David, in this large-scale photograph of the Accademia in Florence, Italy. The colossal sculpture appears to return the gaze of the viewer, his hand poised in a gesture that could be read as a sign to draw nearer—or to stay back.
title: David by Michaelangelo, Galleria dell'Accademia, Firenze #2
